Q26316501: wellington monument may refer to any one of the monuments to arthur wellesley, 1st duke of wellington, (1769 – 1852), a leading british political and military figure of the 19th century, particularly noted for his defeat of napoleon in the battle of waterloo (1815).
this is a list of the monuments erected to him (in rough chronological order):
this monument overlooks the town of wellington, from which wellington's title was taken.
the duke's horse, copenhagen, has a monument over his grave at stratfield saye house,  hampshire.
